title: Can I appeal a decision by the judge to lift a automatic stay?
question: I filed bankruptcy on February 25 2019. I called my landlord and informed him of my filing we briefly discussed the matter. At that time I didnâ€™t no I had to list him as a creditor and there was no talk of eviction. Then on March 15 roughly 2weeks after our conversation I received the first of two 3 day or quits. This three day ask for Jan feb and March rent. On March 22 I paid $1000 on April 1st I paid $1000 on April 2 I recieved the second three day or quit I had amended my schedule properly naming my landlord as a creditor I sent his lawyer a copy and also reached out for some hopeful negotiation. I then recieved a sixty day notice followed by a unlawful Detainer. On June 19 the automatic stay was lifted
answers: My colleagues have given you accurate advice. Landlords have an expedited means to regain possession of their property. It sounds like the LL has following that process. Bankruptcy may discharge any pre-petition rent, but since you are still in possession of the property after the bankruptcy, you are out of options. You can get a 4th opinion by contacting an Avvo lawyer in your area for a sit down consultation. Some offer a free 30 minute consultation. Take them up on it.

You can't appeal because you have no basis to appeal.
The only issue considered by the court is whether you were current or not. You weren't.
It looks to me like you've paid $2k so far toward 6 months of rent. Filing BK does not require your landlord to negotiate with you.
He may now proceed with the Unlawful Detainer action;; but if you show up with enough funds to bring your rent current, you may be permitted to stay.

No. Time period to appeal has lapsed.
Prepare to move.
